H0.text: Melting and cooling are the actions that must occur for magma to be converted to igneous rock.

H1.text: Heating and pressure are the actions that must occur for magma to be converted to igneous rock.

H2.text: Weathering and erosion are the actions that must occur for magma to be converted to igneous rock.

H3.text: Crystallization and cooling are the actions that must occur for magma to be converted to igneous rock.

A4.text: Igneous rocks are formed through the cooling and solidification of magma or lava.

A5.text: Igneous rock may form with crystallization to form granular, crystalline rocks, or without crystallization to form natural glasses.
